intro: Linosyris megalismontana, commonly known as the giant montane linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
